channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Ilia Malinin, U.S. figure skater favored for gold, finishes 8th
item.description: Malinin, undefeated since 2023, stumbled and fell multiple times, landing far off the podium. Mikhail Shaidorov of Kazakhstan won gold in an upset that shocked even himself.
item.content:encoded:
Malinin, undefeated since 2023, stumbled and fell multiple times, landing far off the podium. Mikhail Shaidorov of Kazakhstan won gold in an upset that shocked even himself.

(Image credit: Andreas Rentz)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: What monogamy in the animal world tells us about ourselves
item.description: As Valentine's Day approaches, we take a look at monogamy and its alternatives among animals — including humans.
item.content:encoded: As Valentine's Day approaches, we take a look at monogamy and its alternatives among animals — including humans.
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Venezuela debates sweeping amnesty for political prisoners
item.description: After the fall of Nicolás Maduro, the Venezuelan regime promise amnesty and reconciliation — but for hundreds still jailed and thousands facing charges, justice remains uncertain.
item.content:encoded:
After the fall of Nicolás Maduro, the Venezuelan regime promise amnesty and reconciliation — but for hundreds still jailed and thousands facing charges, justice remains uncertain.

(Image credit: Ariana Cubillos)
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: View from Ukraine
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks to Chrystia Freeland, former Canadian Deputy Prime Minister and current economic adviser to Ukrainian President Zelenskyy, about Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks to Chrystia Freeland, former Canadian Deputy Prime Minister and current economic adviser to Ukrainian President Zelenskyy, about Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Karen Zamora

item.title: An Olympic miss by Mikaela Shiffrin has fed her doubters. But her story isn't done
item.description: Mikaela Shiffrin is the winningest Alpine ski racer ever, but she's been unable to medal in the last two Olympics. She has some barriers to overcome if she's going to succeed in Cortina.
item.content:encoded: Mikaela Shiffrin is the winningest Alpine ski racer ever, but she's been unable to medal in the last two Olympics. She has some barriers to overcome if she's going to succeed in Cortina.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: A woman grieving her divorce found comfort from a couple on the trail
item.description: The news of Kristi Reeves' finalized divorce hit her hard, so she grabbed her shoes and headed for the mountains. On the trail, she encountered a couple.
item.content:encoded: The news of Kristi Reeves' finalized divorce hit her hard, so she grabbed her shoes and headed for the mountains. On the trail, she encountered a couple.

item.title: Trump faces off with governors ahead of next week's meeting
item.description: President Trump has shown a willingness to attack Democratic norms and traditions, including injecting partisanship in places typically immune to it.
item.content:encoded: President Trump has shown a willingness to attack Democratic norms and traditions, including injecting partisanship in places typically immune to it.
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Oscar nominee Wagner Moura talks about the spirituality of the stage
item.description: Wagner Moura is the first-ever Brazilian to be nominated for the Oscar for Best Actor for his role in "The Secret Agent." On Wild Card, he reflected on his career on stage.
item.content:encoded: Wagner Moura is the first-ever Brazilian to be nominated for the Oscar for Best Actor for his role in "The Secret Agent." On Wild Card, he reflected on his career on stage.

item.title: Dungeons & Dragons, long played for fun, is being explored for therapeutic potential
item.description: Dungeons & Dragons is known as a niche role-playing game. But now game masters are exploring whether it can also be therapeutic, for conditions ranging from anxiety to PTSD.
item.content:encoded: Dungeons & Dragons is known as a niche role-playing game. But now game masters are exploring whether it can also be therapeutic, for conditions ranging from anxiety to PTSD.
item.dc:creator: Deena Prichep

item.title: DHS is poised for a shutdown after lawmakers fail to strike a deal on funding
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security is on track to shut down Friday night after Congress left town without a deal to fund the department and limit the tactics of federal immigration officers.
item.content:encoded: The Department of Homeland Security is on track to shut down Friday night after Congress left town without a deal to fund the department and limit the tactics of federal immigration officers.
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas
